meanings.definition: To reduce in size, scale, or quality.
meanings.sent1: I had to downscale my project to make it fit the time limit.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to downscale its operations due to financial difficulties.
meanings.sent3: When the cake was too big, I had to downscale it by cutting it in half.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of becoming a famous singer were downscaled to performing at local events.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to downscale the painting to fit it on a smaller canvas.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a lower social or economic class.
meanings.sent1: The downscale neighborhood had affordable housing options.
meanings.sent2: She preferred shopping at downscale stores to save money.
meanings.sent3: The downscale party was surprisingly fun with its casual atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The downscale restaurant served delicious comfort food at reasonable prices.
meanings.sent5: His downscale background did not deter him from pursuing his dreams.

meanings.definition: To move or be moved to a lower level or status.
meanings.sent1: After the scandal, the celebrity's career began to downscale rapidly.
meanings.sent2: The company had to downscale its workforce to stay afloat.
meanings.sent3: The balloon started to downscale as the air leaked out slowly.
meanings.sent4: Her popularity downscaled after she made controversial remarks.
meanings.sent5: The team had to downscale their ambitions after facing multiple setbacks.
